subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{lb|zh|military}} [[brigade]]
# {{†}} [[army]]; [[troops]]
# {{†}} an army consisting of 500 [[soldiers]]
# {{†}} [[traveller]]
# [[journey]]; [[trip]]
# {{†}} [[hotel]]
# to [[travel]]
# 56th [[hexagram]] of the [[I Ching]]
# {{surname|lang=zh}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: * {{sense|military}} Under the [[w:National Revolutionary Army|National Revolutionary Army]], a brigade was composed of two [[regiment]]s ({{zh-l|*團}}). In turn, two brigades formed a [[division]] ({{zh-l|*整編師}}), a [[square division]].

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|旅舍|旅社|套裝旅遊|勁旅|庭實旅百|師旅|商旅|住宅旅社|客旅|徒步旅行|一成一旅|商旅店|單車旅行|差旅費|公文旅行|旅歷|文件旅遊|旅力|旅思|旅生|旅遊業|旅館業|旅客|旅行支票|旅鼠|旅程|旅遊手冊|振旅|汽車旅館|旅進旅退|旅館|旅長|旅行劇團|旅行|旅行團|旅邸|旅人蕉|旅居|旅費|旅行社|旅遊|旅祉|知性之旅|旅途|旅食|畢業旅行|旅次|旅行包|旅順|旅酬|旅行車|旅伴|旅店|旅夜書懷|旅人|觀光旅館|羈旅|鞠旅|軍旅|羇旅|逆旅|陳師鞠旅|自助旅遊|賓旅|赤軍旅|自主旅遊|虎旅|自助旅行|行旅}}

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょ}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=りょ}} {{m|zh|旅|tr=ljo{{sup|X}}||a military unit of 500 men; to go [on a sortie; on a trip or journey]}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The prefix usage only ever appears in kanji compounds.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たび}}
/tabi{{sub|1}}/ → /tabi/

From {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=たび}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Appears in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed no earlier than 759 and one of the oldest extant texts in the Japanese language.

May be cognate with {{m|ja|度|tr=tabi||the time when something happens}}; both terms have the same pitch accent, the same ancient vowel values, and some semantic overlap.

subSections.title: Noun
Verb
subSections.text:
{{ja-verb-suru|たび|tr=intrans}}

# to [[travel]], to [[go]] on a [[journey]] or [[trip]]
